intro: Polemonium occidentale subsp. typicum, commonly known as Western Jacob's ladder, is a herbaceous perennial native to the western United States. It features lance-shaped leaves that are opposite along the stem, with a bluish-green hue. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped, pink to purple flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for woodland gardens and native plant landscapes.
